title: Create an order
content_markdown:
Version: 8.1Sales EnterpriseSales Commerce
On this page
Manage all Creatio orders in the **Orders** section, from registration to successful delivery. You can add installment plans, product lists, discounts and other data to your orders.
The section includes multiple [quick filters](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=1017#title-1755-1).
* By order issue date (the **Date** field). Displays orders created within the specified period. To view the orders created on a specific day, set the day as both the start and end date.
* By status (the **Status** field). Displays orders that have the specified status.
* By owner (the **Owner** field). Displays orders whose owner is the specified contact.
## Create an order from the Orders section​
1. **Open the Orders section**.
2. **Click New**. This opens the order page.
3. **Specify the order recipient** in the **Contact** and **Account** fields.
4. **Save the record** and reopen the page. Creatio generates order number automatically according to the "Order number mask" ("OrderCodeMask" code) [system setting](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=269).
5. **Fill out the Product list**. You can do this in multiple ways:
1. Click ![btn_com_add_tab.png](https://academy.creatio.com/guides/sites/en/files/documentation/user/en/short_sales/BPMonlineHelp/short_sales_create_order/btn_com_add_tab.png) to open the product selection page.
2. Click **New** at the bottom of the list.
If necessary, add a discount on specific products in the **Discount,%** field. Learn more in the "[Add products to an invoice or an order](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=1223)" article.
As a result, the total cost of the order will be calculated in the **Total, $** label.
6. **Add an order installment plan** on the **Payment & delivery** tab. Learn more: [Add an order installment plan](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=1334).
You can **submit orders for approval** to other Creatio users, for example, managers, using out-of-the-box approval function. Approvals are available for orders on **Confirmation** and **In progress** stages. To do this use the **Send for approval** button on the order page. The action opens an additional page where you set approval parameters. Learn more: [Approvals](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=1833).
Fig. 1 Send the order for approval
![Fig. 1 Send the order for approval](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/academy_en/files/images/Composable_apps/Order_and_contract_management/scr_send_order_for_approval.png)
## Create an order based on opportunity​
note
If you have both **Lead and Opportunity Management** and **Order and Contract Management** apps installed, you can create one or more orders based on an opportunity at any stage of the opportunity management process.
1. **Open the Opportunities section**.
2. **Open the relevant opportunity**.
3. Click ![btn_create_an_order.png](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/en/files/images/Composable_apps/Lead_And_Opportunity_Management/add_order_based_on_opportunity/btn_create_an_order.png) in the top right (Fig. 2) to **add an order**. This opens the order page. If you have any products added to the opportunity, Creatio copies the products to the order.
Fig. 2 Create an order based on opportunity
![Fig. 2 Create an order based on opportunity](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/academy_en/files/images/Composable_apps/Order_and_contract_management/scr_create_an_order_from_opportunity.png)
4. **Fill out additional information** on the order page. For example, generate an installment plan or specify delivery information. 
5. **Save the order**.
As a result, Creatio will add an order connected to the opportunity. You will be able to open the order from the opportunity page by using the **History** tab.
## Create an order based on lead​
note
If you have both **Lead and Opportunity Management** and **Order and Contract Management** apps installed, you can create one or more orders based on a lead at any stage of the lead management process.
1. **Open the Leads section**.
2. **Open the relevant lead**.
3. Click ![btn_create_an_order.png](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/en/files/images/Composable_apps/Lead_And_Opportunity_Management/add_order_based_on_opportunity/btn_create_an_order.png) in the top right (Fig. 3) to **add an order**. This opens the order page. If you have any products added to the lead, Creatio copies the products to the order.
Fig. 3 Create an order based on lead
![Fig. 3 Create an order based on lead](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/academy_en/files/images/Composable_apps/Order_and_contract_management/scr_create_an_order_from_lead.png)
4. **Fill out additional information** on the order page. For example, generate an installment plan or specify delivery information. 
5. **Save the order**.
As a result, Creatio will add an order connected to the lead. You will be able to open the order from the lead page by using the **History** tab.
## Add an order installment plan​
Creatio lets you add an individual installment plan for the order on the **Payment & Delivery** tab. To fill out the installment plan:
1. **Open the corresponding order** page → **Payment & Delivery** tab.
2. Click **New** on the **Installment plan** expanded list to **add installment plan step**.
3. **Fill out each installment plan step** :
Name| The step name, for example, "Prepaid" or "Full delivery."  
---|---  
Type| "Delivery" or "Payment."  
Status| The step status. "Completed" or "Uncompleted."  
Percentage, %| The expected delivery or payment amount in percentage.  
Invoice| Select or [add an invoice](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=1004) connected to the current step of the installment plan.  
Products| Specify products to pay or deliver during this step.  
4. Repeat steps 2 – 3 of the current instruction to **add and fill out all needed installment plan steps**.
5. **Save the installment plan**.
* * *
## See also​
[Create an invoice](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=1004)
[Create a contract from an order](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=1339)
[Orders FAQ](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=2303)
